remarks: This theorem is the raison d'être for the directed integral, because unlike ~ itgspliticc , there is no constraint on the ordering of the points ` A , B , C ` in the domain.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 13-Aug-2014.)
statement:
ditgsplit.x $e |- ( ph -> X e. RR ) $.
ditgsplit.y $e |- ( ph -> Y e. RR ) $.
ditgsplit.a $e |- ( ph -> A e. ( X [,] Y ) ) $.
ditgsplit.b $e |- ( ph -> B e. ( X [,] Y ) ) $.
ditgsplit.c $e |- ( ph -> C e. ( X [,] Y ) ) $.
ditgsplit.d $e |- ( ( ph /\ x e. ( X (,) Y ) ) -> D e. V ) $.
ditgsplit.i $e |- ( ph -> ( x e. ( X (,) Y ) |-> D ) e. L^1 ) $.
ditgsplit $p |- ( ph -> S_ [ A -> C ] D _d x = ( S_ [ A -> B ] D _d x + S_ [ B -> C ] D _d x ) ) $.
$d A x $.
$d B x $.
$d C x $.
$d V x $.
$d X x $.
$d Y x $.
$d ph x $.
